'''Pinnath Gelin''' or '''Green Hills''' was a fief in the far west of [[Gondor]], bounded to the west by the River [[Lefnui]], and to the east by the [[Morthond]].<ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref>

==History==
At the time of the [[War of the Ring]], the lord of this region was [[Hirluin|Hirluin the Fair]]. He led three hundred of his soldiers to the defence of [[Minas Tirith]], all dressed in green.<ref name="MT">{{RK|MT}}, p. 770</ref> During the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]] Hirluin rode with [[Húrin (Warden of the Keys)|Húrin the Tall]], [[Imrahil]] and the horsemen of Gondor rode eastward from Minas Tirith to the aid of [[Éomer]] and the [[Rohirrim]].<ref name="Battle2">{{RK|Battle}}, p. 846</ref> Hirluin did not survive the battle and never went back to the Green Hills of his home.<ref name="Battle">{{RK|Battle}}, p. 849</ref>

==Etymology==
''Pinnath Gelin'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. It is usually translated as "Green Hills"<ref name="MT" /><ref name="Battle2"/> and sometimes as "Green Downs",<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Pinnath Gelin'', p. 525</ref> "Green Slopes", "Green Crests/Ridges"<ref>{{PE|17}}, entry S ''Pinnath Gelin'', p. 97</ref> or "Green-crests".<ref>{{PE|17}}, root KWIN-, p. 173</ref> The first word was the dialectical [[Sindarin]] or [[Gondor Sindarin]] plural ''[[pinnath]]'' ("hill sides", "downs", "slopes", "crests", "ridges").<ref>{{PE|17}}, entry S '''penna''', p. 24</ref> The second was a [[lenition|lenited]] version of the plural form of the word ''[[calen]]'' ("green").<ref>{{PE|17}}, entry root GAL, p. 153</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-840835225.html|articlename=S. ''Pinnath Gelin'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=22 June 2024}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Pinnath Gelin map.jpg|thumb|right|Map of Pinnath Gelin in''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' ]]
'''2023: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Added with the ''Corsairs of Umbar'' expansion, Pinnath Gelin is a lush and fertile land, full of farms that serve as the breadbasket of [[Gondor]]. [[Hirluin]]'s seat in ''Ost Arndir'' has been inherited by his daughter, Lady ''Nauriel''. Her young son is named ''Thorongil'' after the [[Aragorn|great hero of Gondor]].
